Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Poncho \Pon"cho\, n.; pl. {Ponchos}. [Sp.] 1. A kind of cloak worn by the Spanish Americans, having the form of a blanket, with a slit in the middle for the head to pass through. A kind of poncho made of rubber or painted cloth is used by the mounted troops in the United States service. [1913 Webster]
2. A trade name for camlets, or stout worsteds. [1913 Webster]
poncho n : a blanket-like cloak with a hole in the center for the head
